title: ​On This Date, Marijuana Will Finally Become Legal in Canada
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
While the federal government will be in charge of ensuring the safety and security of the country’s marijuana , provinces will have the right to decide how marijuana is distributed and sold, as well as its price. Federally, the age to buy marijuana will be 18, but provinces can also decide to set a higher age. 
If you want to go the more DIY route and grow at home instead of going through a dispensary, there will be a four-plant limit per household. 
But don’t think Canada is a marijuana safe haven just yet. Trudeau warned earlier this month that, “Until we have a framework to control and regulate marijuana, the current laws apply.” 
In the United States, eight states have legalized marijuana recreationally, while another 18 allow the drug for medicinal use. However, current Attorney General Jeff Sessions has a history of opposing legalization , which has been a cause of concern for those in the industry.
